title: The 9th-gen iPad is still in stock and down to an incredibly low price today
content:
Macworld

Apple might have stopped selling the 9th-gen iPad, but that doesn’t mean it’s not still one of the best tablets for browsing, games, and streaming. The original MSRP was $329 and it’s usually on sale for $249, but today you can get it even cheaper: Amazon has slashed the raining stock of the 64GB iPad to $224, a savings of over $100 and the best price we’ve ever seen. The 256GB model is also on sale for $119 off bringing the price down to $360.

The 9th-gen iPad has a 10.2-inch display, an A13 chip, and a 12MP Ultra Wide camera with Center Stage. It’s the only iPad you can buy with a Home button and a Lightning port and is great for kids and students.

We don’t know how much stock Amazon has, so if you want a great tablet at a great price, go grab it right now.

The 9th-gen iPad is down to $224.
View Deal
